text: it's been 15 years since a chef named
John shank showed me how to make his
broccoli rabe with garlic rattan and at
the time it was really new to me
since then I've completely integrated it
and all of its permutations so I'm gonna
start with already cooked broccoli rabe
poached until it's you know crisp tender
as you would say not mushy but certainly
limp and bright green fair man of oil
couple tablespoons maybe four and then
fair man and garlic to five six cloves
peeled and cut into slivers you want to
cook this slowly because garlic treated
gently like this you can use a lot you
can use twice as much of this it would
still be great it's gonna become very
sweet and a little bit crisp okay so
that's simmering away and we're just
gonna chop this broccoli rabe I've
drained it I've squeezed the excess
moisture out of it and to make it easier
to handle and to eat we're gonna chop it
up I'm winding up with bite-sized pieces
I have about a minute to go on this
garlic here you can do this with any
green you can name spinach is kind of
the obvious choice
broccoli is great cauliflower which is
not green but you can treat it as if it
were cabbage anything in that family bok
choy you can see the garlic becoming
brown some of the pieces are completely
brown some of them are just crisping at
the edges just about ready you don't
want anything to get really any browner
than red golden brown okay and then end
goes the broccoli rabe
some salt and pepper
toss that with the garlic this this
stage is really a minute just really
tossing the cooked garlic with the
broccoli rabe and the oil and that'll go
into any kind of nice oven proof dish
that you have and that you'd like to use
for this of course now you could eat
this like this and it would be terrific
but to make a killer sprinkle it with
Parmesan and this could be blue cheese
or a mixture of parmesan and blue cheese
is great
probably best the best combination
parmesan and breadcrumbs but parmesan
alone fantastic and then into a moderate
oven say 350 could be as high as 400
until the parmesan melts and Browns
little will chill probably about 10
minutes it's been about 15 minutes
closer you see the parmesan is browned
and crusted a little bit not entirely
melted everywhere you've got this
variety of different states of parmesan
nests and the broccoli rabe is a little
darker obviously but really beautiful
and very hot so you can try this with
any number vegetables you want but this
is really an supremely variable flexible
recipe but this this version is really
where you should start because it is a
